meanings.definition: To eject liquid in a thin stream
meanings.sent1: I saw the water squirt out of the hose.
meanings.sent2: The lemon squirted juice when I squeezed it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child squirted ketchup all over the table.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes squirted tears when she heard the sad news.
meanings.sent5: The fountain squirted water high into the air.

meanings.definition: A small amount of liquid ejected in a thin stream
meanings.sent1: He added a squirt of ketchup to his fries.
meanings.sent2: The soap dispenser released a squirt of soap.
meanings.sent3: The tiny squirt of lemon juice made the dish taste fresh.
meanings.sent4: A squirt of perfume lingered in the air after she passed by.
meanings.sent5: The chef added a squirt of olive oil to the salad.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that squirts
meanings.sent1: The squirt at the water park made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The little squirt of a boy ran around the playground.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirt sprayed water at his friends.
meanings.sent4: The playful squirt of a puppy chased its tail.
meanings.sent5: The squirt of a water gun surprised the unsuspecting cat.
